Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 01:44PM Magawisca wrote: Thank you to everyone who responded. This is an amazing community. Following your advice, I demanded that someone speak to me. Yesterday the nurse in my primary doctor's office told me that "things are probably fine or they would have called you already." This afternoon my primary told me that it's a cyst & that my gyn would tell me more.  Jule, I will return here to check on you. You are in my prayers.
Posts.Title: Would a Doctor Make Me Wait? Magawisca jpann39

Posts.Content: Magawisca wrote: Greetings Community, I had a mammogram yesterday morning after finding a lump. This is my second lump, the first was removed over one decade ago. My primary informed me that he received the mammogram results today & that we will discuss it during my annual exam. My gyn, who sent me to get the mammogram and untrasound, told me that they would get back to me with the results in seven to ten days. Overwhelmed with fear & anxiety, I have taken my gyn's 7-10  time frame as a positive sign. Have others had to wait that long when the results of a mammogram or u/s when results are of concern? Should I still be worried so that I am not blindsided by the potential results. Thank you in advance for any guidance you may be able to provide.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Would a Doctor Make Me Wait? Magawisca jpann39

Posts.Content: May 12, 2009 11:23AM - edited May 12, 2009 11:25AM by Magawisca Thank you jpann39 for your perspective. And I wish you well.
Posts.Title: Would a Doctor Make Me Wait? Magawisca jpann39

Posts.Content: May 12, 2009 01:41PM - edited May 12, 2009 01:48PM by Magawisca Thank you very much. I will do just that. Interestingly, I'm normally quite a take-charge person. But I guess I'm scared and am allowing people to run over me.
